website_summaries.verdict: If you're looking for a smaller soft-shell bag that's built for the rigors of travel, this one is worth a look.
pros: softside bag that garners enthusiasm for the smooth-rolling wheels
cons: May not work for all airlines as a carry-on

customer_reviews.title: Looked good out of the box but lasted only one trip before breaking
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this suitcase a month ago from Luggage Pros through Amazon. I used it as carry on luggage once and the extendable handle broke off. I attempted to return it as defective, but since it was 32 days since I bought it, my return was rejected. I can't recommend buying such a poorly made product.
customer_reviews.author: Chris P

customer_reviews.title: Terrible.
customer_reviews.text: Alrwady ripped. My product arrived Monday and today is Thursday and the mesh in my bag has already ripped with just one undergarment in it.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: but I don't recommend going for the Aspire Xlite line of products
customer_reviews.text: The Aspire Xlite expandable spinner is not durable. I bought it in September, and after 2 flights in October, it was heavily distressed and damaged. And of course, the factory warranty doesn't cover this transportation damage caused by airlines. The older Samsonite spinner luggage we have for over 10 years shows only minor signs of wear. Don't know, if this is a design fluke or problems of low-quality manufacturing contractor, but I don't recommend going for the Aspire Xlite line of products.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: TOO LARGE TO MEET CARRY ON SIZE RESTRICTIONS
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware. The body dimensions of this suitcase barely meet the new standard for carry on -- but the overall dimensions DO NOT. This is too large for a carry on for most domestic airlines (with the wheels it's larger in every dimension than 9x22x14).
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn D Bucheri

customer_reviews.title: Consider the Color of the Suitcase
customer_reviews.text: I have had this suitcase for about 4 months and it has gone on 6 flights in the time that I have owned it. Pros: - Lightweight so it's easier to not go over airlines baggage weight limits. - Plastic interior pocket for toiletries so that if something leaks it won't get all over the rest of the items in the bag. - Large suitcase! - 4 wheels which make is easy to navigate. - Overall very good quality bag. Cons: - Although the blue color is pretty, it scuffed up and got dirty on the first flight. Darker color suitcases hide the dirt/scuffs but the blue color doesn't. I wish that it had some type of stain guard.
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Love this blue luggage
customer_reviews.text: This luggage is huge! I fit so much in it for my cruise. I had room leftover. No problems with the airlines as it is right at the size limit. Just make sure you weigh it at home (or buy a luggage scale, so worth it), it's EASY to go over the 50 lb weight limit since this thing can fit so much stuff. It's also worth noting that buying BLUE luggage is the best idea! So many black pieces of luggage, it's worth it to spend a little more on the blue.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Meets my needs!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I've been looking for to ride on the top of my wheeled suitcase with a strap on the back to hold it in place. Perfect size. Well made. In Amtrak sleeping cars I leave my wheeled suitcase downstairs and take a small bag upstairs into my room and this will be just right for what I need during trips. It was VERY hard to find a bag this size without wheels and a pull-out handle that unnecessarily take up room and add to the weight. I looked at Macy's, JCPenney and Sears and found nothing like this. Thankfully, Amazon almost always has what I'm looking for! I've not used it yet, but I can't imagine I'll be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Heywood

customer_reviews.title: Could not have asked for more in a piece of luggage
customer_reviews.text: This bag is very sturdy, yet light. The size is just at the limit for checked luggage, but because it is so large, your greatest concern will be overpacking and exceeding the 50-pound​ limit. I like the interior compartment for toiletries and the spinner wheels made it very easy to maneuver.
customer_reviews.author: otterpops

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't spin
customer_reviews.text: I must have gotten a dud. This is the worst spinner I've ever had. I just bought it for a week long trip, and when fully packed, it doesn't actually spin. The only way to steer it upright, is turned around in the same way that you would pull it on two wheels. It wont roll turned sideways, which is the whole reason to buy a spinner. It took serious strength to try to keep it from turning the only way it wanted to turn. I'm very disappointed. I've had many samsonite suitcases in the past, that were all great. The interior of this works perfectly, but it shouldn't be called a spinner.
customer_reviews.author: Dez

customer_reviews.title: How is this item new?
customer_reviews.text: There was someone's ear buds, IPhone charger, key fob badge in a small black bag as well as a black cloth bag labeled "Hair Dryer " that you find at hotel rooms INSIDE THE FRONT POCKET IF THE SUITCASE! If this is new, why are there personal items in the suitcase?
customer_reviews.author: Amy Stahlecker

customer_reviews.title: Not for the frequent flyer!
customer_reviews.text: Looks well made, but did not hold up to frequent travel. Probably a great choice if you travel once every two or three years. Zippers started falling apart after just a couple of months of weekly travel.
customer_reviews.author: Carl D

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't hold up!!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this suitcase since October and the handle has broken beyond repair. Since it's past Amazon's 30 day return window, I'm forced to deal with Samsonite customer service. I'm almost certain I'll have to drive it to a nearby (ha!) service center for repair. In the meantime, I'm without my luggage and I travel Mon-Fri for my job. Guess I'll pack my belongings in a duffel bag and drag it around the airport! It'll probably hold up longer than this suitcase! Buyer beware!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The reviews were great on this bag but sadly the zippers on the ...
customer_reviews.text: The reviews were great on this bag but sadly the zippers on the outer pocket broke on my very trip and lost all the content that was in the pocket. I will happily update this review if I can get a replacement bag. As it stands, I would not recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: jon anderson

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect Suitcase
customer_reviews.text: I have tried a number of suitcases, all of which have been destroyed by various airlines. (They are very good at this.) This suitcase is my favorite. It opens at the top rather than the middle, so it fits on a luggage rack (or bureau) and the fabric is tough. Only once have I had a zipper broken (a little one that apparently caught on something - the airline reimbursed me) and recently the brand label came off. That matters more to Samsonite than me. It comes in different colors so you can find it easily. The only way I have ever destroyed one is by having my cat pee on it. (She was mad that I left.) Perfect suitcase!
customer_reviews.author: Shergie

customer_reviews.title: Fit the Alaska airline carry-on limit
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to find a suitcase which would fit the Alaska airline carry-on limit (which is a bit smaller than the international flight carry-on size) but maximize the size, and this one seemed to fit the bill. I just used it for a trip to Hawaii and it worked great. The zippers, the wheels, the handle all performed perfectly. I loved it. Highly recommend this if you need a carry-on that you are sure will fit into the carry-on limit of major domestic airlines but also carry lots of stuff.
customer_reviews.author: C. Lee

customer_reviews.title: The quality of the bag is good, however
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the bag is good, however, the measurements are misleading. This bag would not pass as a carry-on bag, it's actually larger than the standard 22 x 14 x 9 limit. I contacted Samsonite and they told me that I should have read the "actual overall measurement", which is not listed anywhere, including on the tag on the bag itself. Buyer beware if planning to use as a carry-on bag.
customer_reviews.author: Terri George

customer_reviews.title: Slim, Sturdy, Everything you need in a carry-on
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for a carry-on luggage for a while, and this product is exactly what I've needed. The material's sturdy, wheels move smoothly, handles are reliable, and it has all the pockets you really need. It's just under the restrictions for most airlines, so it's not bulky. It's pretty slim even when you pack it fully. I was on a small plane from SFO to BOI, and they had stopped accepting carry-on luggages, but they said they'd try to bring in slimmer luggages if they could fit, and luckily mine, along with 7 others, were accepted. Really recommend this luggage!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Nice lightweight all purpose family suitcase.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very lightweight suitcase that can hold a week's worth of clothes and toiletries with no problem. I used it for a Caribbean vacation where I brought lots of shoes/sandals, dresses, shorts, multiple bottles of sunscreen, and towels. There was no issue getting everything to fit without cramming and ending up with clothes that are a wrinkled mess. The wheels work well, both when pulling or pushing the suitcase, and it was very light. I bought the red color to stand out on the luggage rack. Would definitely recommend and buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Decent for airline jobs
customer_reviews.text: I am an airline pilot and I bought this when I got hired. I have been using it about 3 months and it has held up so far. It is slightly wider than the matching roll aboard so it does not fit through the aisle on an airplane. A few times I have been dragging while attached to the top of my roll aboard and it has spun around the handle and been dragging. I would like to see a tighter strap for attaching to the handle of your other luggage. For the size it does seem to have a lot of space.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Stoddard

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: IT MOVES EASILY, LOOKS ATTRACTIVE, AND HAS PLENTY OF SPACE
customer_reviews.author: Tonita H. Rowden

customer_reviews.title: A HINDRANCE, NOT A HELP
customer_reviews.text: The wheels did not work properly. It was almost impossible to push it through airport, which was the primary reason I purchased this luggage. I just returned from a river cruise in Europe and this suitcase caused me more problems than anything else on the trip.
customer_reviews.author: DukeRules

customer_reviews.title: No!
customer_reviews.text: Horrible!!!! Was destroyed after one use!! I don't know if the one I received was already defective upon arrival or what. The zippers broke and a wheel fell off.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Lasted five trips. Very poor quality
customer_reviews.text: This bag is garbage. Year and a half. Five trips, and the telescopic system is shot. Samsonite used to mean quality. Not anymore. Do not buy this bag.
customer_reviews.author: McMasters

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, good looking, well laid-out
customer_reviews.text: This product seems to have a very sturdy design. The interior pocketing, layout and straps are both aesthetically pleasing and utilitarian. I have flown and driven with this product several times and haven't had issue with damage or wear yet. I expect that it will last me a good while even as a weekly flier.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Williams

customer_reviews.title: Nice luggage!  Be aware of temporary odor.,
customer_reviews.text: Very Functional. I like the spinner and the expandable feature. I also like all the compartments. If you are making a last minute trip, you will need time to "air it out" before using it. The smell was terrible at first, but after a few days it was fine.
customer_reviews.author: Deb in NC

customer_reviews.title: Chemical Smell
customer_reviews.text: Has a terrible chemical smell. I thought maybe all luggage would smell this way, but I bought another brand it does not smell nearly as bad. If you care at all about that type of thing, I'd stay away from this one.
customer_reviews.author: Kalel

customer_reviews.title: I am impressed with the quality.
customer_reviews.text: My son needed a set of luggage so I bought the 25" suitcase and 20" carry on here on Amazon. I bought an older Spinner series at Kohl's for myself around 5 years ago and it looks like new. I have been very pleased with my luggage. The suitcases arrived quickly, intact and undamaged even though there was no extra packing in the boxes. My son was impressed with the quality as well. He has yet to use them and will update after several trips to let everyone know how they fared.
customer_reviews.author: Summer3367

customer_reviews.title: Good Bag.
customer_reviews.text: I flew Aer Lingus, to Ireland, and they're restrictions for under the seat are kind of small, but this fit just fine. I was able to carry a lot of things that wouldn't fit into my carry-on. The only draw-back, is that there are no pockets on the end of the back, so it's not easy to get into during flight. Other than that, tho, I am really pleased.
customer_reviews.author: LilBit

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Product ripped open after only 7 months of normal usage of traveling once per week. Customer service in repairing the issue under warranty was not helpful. I’ve sent the piece of luggage to a repair center, and 3 months later, have not heard a thing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This bag is sturdy and well made
customer_reviews.text: This bag is sturdy and well made. My only complaint is the smart sleeve (that allows it to slide over upright suitcase handles) is a little wide and slips around when I have it attached to my suitcase handle. This may not be an issue with other suitcase brands but, with mine, it's annoying. The reason I bought a bag with this feature was to avoid carrying it around separately.
customer_reviews.author: Larry in FL

customer_reviews.title: ... up well on a recent 19 day trip to Great Britain.
customer_reviews.text: quality luggage and it held up well on a recent 19 day trip to Great Britain.
customer_reviews.author: Lizzie

customer_reviews.title: This luggage is medium quality for Samsonite. The biggest ...
customer_reviews.text: This luggage is medium quality for Samsonite. The biggest thing to note. This bag is actually larger then 62" which for most Airlines is the maximum size for checked bags before you have to pay for a oversize bag fee. I measure this at 63 1/2" total. You could argue the 1/2" but it is 63". Airlines are strict and remember at check in, most try to make money with extra baggage fee's. In the pictures I put the tape measure hook over the edge of the while measuring.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: A lightweight Luggage that will serve you well.
customer_reviews.text: We finally bought new luggage for our upcoming trip and this suitcase fit the bill. It is so very light but it is so well made. Easy to roll around and the color is a fantastic blue. Can't wait to use it. I already have it packed and so much fits inside.
customer_reviews.author: Maria C. Paino

customer_reviews.title: Great bag.
customer_reviews.text: held up great on a 10 day trip to Europe and then a 2 week vacation to see family. It is expandable which helped on the return trip for both vacations. I like that it has a handle on the bottom as well as the top and sides. That helped a great deal when getting it in and out of the car or off the luggage return at the airport.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Great Boarding Bag for underseat
customer_reviews.text: Great bag, I'd like more pockets, but I use packing cubes a lot, so it's not a big deal. The zippered part in the front fits my Ipad. Very nice looking and sturdy, but it will squish for going under the seat.
customer_reviews.author: PamelaJane

customer_reviews.title: Light, sturdy case!
customer_reviews.text: This does not expand! I thought I read somewhere that it did. But I don't need the expansion anyway. I find it annoying when people over stuff carry on luggage and jam it into an overhead bin. This case is super light, fits a ton, and is perfect for a three or four day trip when you don't want to check a bag. I love the spinner style, makes it easy for me to navigate through the Atlanta airport. I've always loved Samsonite, always high quality and exactly what you want.
customer_reviews.author: Nick P.

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: The nicest thing I can say about this bag is I like the built in plastic bag compartment, after that its down hill. The handle feels like it is going to fall apart, it is sloppy and rattles. The wheels barley turn. It feels like you are pulling it across carpet and it has no wheels. This bag is not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Not Much of a Spinner
customer_reviews.text: Would not roll in a straight line. OK when empty, but any load made it impossible to comfortably use for any length of time.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Z

customer_reviews.title: Perfect bag!
customer_reviews.text: I travel constantly for work and this is a perfect carry on. Fits a lot (I also use space bags) and no wait at the carousel nor bag fees! Win Win
customer_reviews.author: law

customer_reviews.title: What a great piece of luggage
customer_reviews.text: What a great piece of luggage! The size is airline approved (used on United), including the wheels. When traveling on a small plane with small overhead storage, it will fit under the seat. On a large plane, it fits overhead. It rolls up and down the isle with ease. I plan to use it whenever I fly.
customer_reviews.author: Jo Ann Neal

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in Samsonite
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this luggage because I have another Samsonite that I have been very pleased with. However, the aspire xlite was a huge disappointment. I used it for an international trip and found that it was extremely difficult to move around. I ended up pushing it with both hands and, even then, it kept going to the left side. I was literally pushing and pulling and, if I was on carpet or had to go over bumps, like those for the blind, it took even more effort to keep it going. It was very irritating and exhausting to manipulate in the airports. My son had a different bag the same size and it moved so effortlessly! I was so envious!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Spinner wheels do not function properly
customer_reviews.text: Samsonite Aspire xLite Expandable 25" Spinner has horrible spinner wheels that would not track where I wanted it to go in the airport. The luggage plowed into me a few times and it would steer on it's own. it took too much effort to control. I had an older carry-on Samsonite that is much superior to this one with regards to the spinner wheels functionality. Returning it back.
customer_reviews.author: Mike at CT

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Suitcase
customer_reviews.text: This suitcase has been great and worked as expected. It's sturdy, and the larger wheels have made it more pleasant than a standard spinning suitcase for work travel. I bought it specifically to get away from the clack-clack-clack sound my old spinner would make when traveling between transit, hotel, and office. In all it's held up great through several trips, has fit without issue in domestic overhead bins, and still looks great.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Forshee

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong with Samsonite!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for a carry on. My old one, which was not Samsonite ripped. I decided to spend the extra for Samsonite because it really is the best luggage! It is very spacious too and has a velcro "handle" on the back to hook onto your luggage.
customer_reviews.author: dana

customer_reviews.title: Aspire
customer_reviews.text: Airlines killed my last Samsonite on a trip by breaking the wheel of (second one) as I was arriving on at my destination. I quickly ordered this suitcase to replace in time for my return home. It worked well, held all my clothes, arrived quickly. It's not a well made as my other Samsonite, but I don't fly as much as I used too, so should work fine for car trips, etc. Appreciated the price. I am a Samsonite snob as when I flew a lot, they really held up for years (even the one they broke had made 20+ flights.
customer_reviews.author: J. H. Todsen

customer_reviews.title: It has been over one year and we still cannot ...
customer_reviews.text: It has been over one year and we still cannot get the nasty smell out of this suitcase. I will never buy a suitcase on amazon again as they just smell too bad
customer_reviews.author: Nee2

customer_reviews.title: Great peice of luggage!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this bag. I has the large zippers that are missing from so many bags these days.The outer material is reallyy strong. Has the rubberized edges all the way around the outer seams to prevent wear. Hold a lot of stuff. the only thing I have noticed is the wheels stick out a little past the edge of the bag and will hang in the moving walkways at airports if rolled too close to the edge. I had previosly bought an American tourister bag. It cost less, but it was wrecked after only 4 trips.
customer_reviews.author: R. Fulp

customer_reviews.title: Great Looking and Functional too
customer_reviews.text: This piece was purchased as a gift along with two other pieces. The set looks great and the pieces are easy to maneuver. I was able to save a bundle of money purchasing the pieces separately. The combo offers were significantly higher in cost. The day after I purchased the pieces, one of the pieces dropped in price $30 but Amazon would not refund the difference. Instead, they recommended returning the piece for a refund and re-ordering a second one at the lower price which seemed very inefficient to me.
customer_reviews.author: Jim G

customer_reviews.title: He used it on a United flight to LA and loved it.
customer_reviews.text: I gave it as a gift to someone who wanted an airline approved carry on size. He used it on a United flight to LA and loved it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Roomy and easy to tote.
customer_reviews.text: I had more room than I really needed for a week vacation. It gave me lots of space to bring back souvenirs and to stash a warm jacket inside. I would suggest a black color as the red was very dirty from transporting through airline baggage and was ripped on the outside larger pocket in just one trip. The spinner wheels and handle were great. No strap to hold a bag on top but it would probably be just something to catch and tear. It is certainly wide enough to put a bag on top but maybe a bungy cord or strap from additional bag attached to handle would work.
customer_reviews.author: Loie V.

customer_reviews.title: I love this bag
customer_reviews.text: I love this bag. Fits perfectly under the seat of domestic flights, even on Frontier. On international middle aisle seats it still fits but not as well, but there's more overhead space anyway so it's okay. Simple and very smart design with how it opens up allowing you to really organize efficiently and effectively. I'm a light packer so I can easily be gone for a week with this alone. And that's including items other than clothing. The material seems very sturdy as do the zippers and straps. Plus, it looks very nice and nondescript.
customer_reviews.author: Eric C.

customer_reviews.title: Decent suitcase
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price but the wheels could be bigger. When I travel it is rare that I am always on a smooth floor. When will suitcase manufacturers get it right that we need a suitcase with large rough terrain wheels that can also withstand the abuse of baggage handling in airports.
customer_reviews.author: George J. Posten

customer_reviews.title: Quality you won’t find in the off brands.
customer_reviews.text: This is the third set of luggage we’ve bought in the past 4 years. The others were nice looking off brands and worked but quickly started to show the abuse a few plane rides provide. We saw these on a lightning deal and decided to give them a try. Opening the box revealed a level of quality we hadn’t seen in either of the last two sets. They’ve only made it through one trip but they look and feel like we won’t be needing another set any time soon...
customer_reviews.author: Beau

customer_reviews.title: Not expandable.
customer_reviews.text: This is not expandable!!! I have not used this yet but I will very soon. The website says it is expandable but I promise it is not. The 20 in is but not the 19, check Samonite's website. I do however believe it will be a good piece of luggage. Build quality is good, zippers feel strong. I will update my review after my trip if anything bad comes up.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Best luggage set
customer_reviews.text: I bought the entire set to replace my worn out cheaper luggage set. This color is such a pretty blue/ green. The wheels are easy turn. The pockets and zippers function well. These hold up well on local road trips or when checking your bags at the airport. Best luggage set I’ve ever purchased. It’s worth all the hype and price.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: Good quality. Has plenty of room to pack everything for up to 3-5 days depending how much you pack. I overpack for my 3-4 day trips and this suitcase is perfect. Fits easy in the overhead. Update: After travling with this luggage I find that having only 2 wheels it is clunky and not easy to maneuver. I should have thought about this before I made this purchase and did not notice it was only 2 wheels. I lowerded my original 5 stars down to 4
customer_reviews.author: My Feelings & Thoughts

customer_reviews.title: Pefect Size for a Carry-On Bag
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my husband because he travels a lot. He says it's the perfect size for storing in overhead compartments, and that it's much more compact than his previous carry-on. The four rolling wheels glide nice and smooth.
customer_reviews.author: Jelane

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not great
customer_reviews.text: Stands up well to airline abuse but the wheels are undersized and don't perform well on carpeted areas int he airport/hotel.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't roll straight, have to use it like a two wheeled bag
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't roll straight. This is the second Samsonite carry on bag I have purchased that does not roll straight. It constantly want to pull to the side so I'm fighting it as I'm walking though the airport. Prior to most recent purchases Samsonite rollers had no problem staying straight, something changed with their quality, it's extremely disappointing. If you want a bag with four wheels that actually rolls how it should I would recommend a different brand. I hope this was a defect. Waiting for a replacement from Amazon, I hope it doesn't have the same problem. Will update when I receive it.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Stapleton

customer_reviews.title: Better than the old one
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my 10+ year old Samsonite that disappeared in a recent flood. Better than the old one!
customer_reviews.author: A E BUZZ JEHLE

customer_reviews.title: Wheel bearing wobbled and started locking up after 6 months of use.
customer_reviews.text: Samsonite Warranty Repair(SWR) said this was normal wear and tear after I shipped it to them in Kansas City. SWR wanted $86 plus return shipping to fix this bag. If I had not purchased the Asurion extended warranty I would have just been out of luck. Asurion paid out after my second claim to them, the first time they stated that since it had only been 6 months I had to first make a Samsonite Warranty claim, which cost me shipping to Samsonite of course. Asurion emailed an Amazon Gift card within 5 minutes for the purchase price after the second claim.
customer_reviews.author: ONEGR8AV8R

customer_reviews.title: solid bag
customer_reviews.text: I travel a lot and this has held up very well EXCEPT the red does show all the dirt that the baggage handlers somehow seem to get on it every time I travel. It does clean up well though (thank goodness). Wheels have managed to stay attached, handle still works, all the zippers still work after many, many miles. Hopefully that will continue.
customer_reviews.author: dmg

customer_reviews.title: Good but a limited life
customer_reviews.text: This is good suitcase for the traveler who travels a lot. It is easy to roll and turn in those endless TSA lines. Sufficient interior space for this size. It stands up to the baggage handlers but I think if has a limited life. About 5 years for the professional traveler.
customer_reviews.author: Dac File

customer_reviews.title: This was the perfect size for the airline carry-on restrictions
customer_reviews.text: Went to Ireland for 4 days. This was the perfect size for the airline carry-on restrictions. I was able to pack 4 days of clothes and some smaller essentials. Rolls very nicely. Happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: LilBit

customer_reviews.title: Hassle-Free Carryon
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect bag for a short trip. This was especially good for when I was on a plane. It fit under the seat perfectly so I didn't have to try and put it in the overhead bin. It's made out of strong material and the shoulder strap is comfortable. I would definitely recommend if anyone is looking for a hassle-free​ carryon bag.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Seaman

customer_reviews.title: Best looking carry-on for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Really nice color and accent combo or male or female traveler. Bought it for a gift to match the larger "check-sized" bag. Looks like a purchased set. Used several times already for short trips. Easily fits a weekends worth of clothes, shoes and toiletries for 3 days. Convenient mesh zipper sections in top inside for toiletries and/or smaller items. Outside compartments for easy access and convenience. Four-wheels motion works great on carpet and doesn't roll away on slick floors. Won't fit under the seat, but will easily fit on aircrafts from M380's to 777 wheels first. Would recommend carrying a small lock and easily identifiable tag for the "just in case you have to check it" flights.
customer_reviews.author: dawn M.

customer_reviews.title: Happy with function
customer_reviews.text: Roll carts take some practice in packing stuff in them, but that's my issue. On a long trip, one of the zipper pulls totally ripped off and so we're going to have to create a substitute. But the zippers are durable, but again, anytime you can't lock the zippers they do tend to pull apart some. But the roll cart wheels stayed on.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth J.

customer_reviews.title: Great personal item for weekend flight/trip
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I’ve only taken it on one trip, but it is perfect for a weekend get away. With various airlines (cough cough United) providing affordable seats with less than standard options (e.g., no carry-on bag and personal item only), it was critical that I find a bag I can tuck under the seat and maximie storage capacity. This bag fits the bill. I haven’t taken it on a United flight yet, so I can’t speak to their slightly smaller personal item measurements.
customer_reviews.author: Korey

customer_reviews.title: ... often and this suitcase by far has been the best. Is light
customer_reviews.text: I travel for work often and this suitcase by far has been the best. Is light, is the right size and it looks great. Materials are sturdy and well made. The wheels are smooth and quiet. I will recommend this one over the Spinner one. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Melchor

customer_reviews.title: Product information is incorrect.  Bag has only one exterior pocket.
customer_reviews.text: The product description is misleading. It states there are exterior pocketS. If you are looking for more than one exterior pocket, this is not the product for either of us... It has only ONE exterior pocket (with nothing in the way of pockets in that pocket). By the way, there are also no interior pockets, so if you want to keep your things organized in this bag, it is a bit of a challenge.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Great suitcase.
customer_reviews.text: I like this suitcase a lot more than I thought I would. It's compact, but it held everything I needed for a week-long vacation, and kept it organized, and it fits perfectly in those soon-to-be high-rent overhead compartments. The spinney wheels are great - I've finally arrived in the 21st century. I can fit one of these in the trunk of my Mazda Miata, but not two.
customer_reviews.author: Spacecat

customer_reviews.title: I love this suitcase but I don't love airline baggage handling
customer_reviews.text: This suitcase has been just what I've needed as far as organization and being easy to use. However, after five airline trips in 18 months I've lost two of the zipper pulls. And then on the last trip one entire zipper head was pulled off the main compartment. Luckily it stayed zipped shut and wasn't one of those bags spilling its contents on the carousel. I'm having the zipper replaced and I'll see how it lasts after that.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Luggage!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this luggage piece! Everything from the awesome bright color to the ease of handeling through the airport & the price can't be beat! I bought this bag to travel internationally at the last minute- thank you Amazon for your quick shipping! The size was perfect, exactly as described. Zippers & wheels work perfectly. Love the 360 wheels! Very easy to push this bag with 1 hand and a 2nd bag with the other. Now that's great handeling luggage. I'm very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size. Rolls through NYC
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size. Rolls through NYC. streets to catch the train or bus in the rush after work. Tried many others,but this is the answer for me
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The handle broke
customer_reviews.text: After a year and half of having this the handle would not go down inside any longer after many failed attempts to move it eventually gave way and buckled and broke at the point where it inserts into the bag. I recommend getting a bag with a sturdier handle if you plan on keeping this bag for more than a year.
customer_reviews.author: healthyhabitsAmazon

customer_reviews.title: Great Checked Suitcase
customer_reviews.text: I just completed a 30 day trip around Europe and the Middle East visiting seven cities with this suitcase and it worked out great. Whether using four wheels or two, it got me up and down stairs and bridges and everything else I encountered with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Johnjx

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy carry on bag with in-line skate wheels
customer_reviews.text: I used this on a month long trip, through 4 different airports, as a carry-on and as checked bag, took it on many trains, rolled over miles of sidewalks and streets. The handles, zippers, and wheels are sturdy and everything is still intact, ready to go on more trips. If you want a carry-on bag with in-line skate wheels, this is a great one to get. Very happy with this carry-on and highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: so cal amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: Damaged Item - Very Unhappy
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item and following the first time I used it I noticed a huge hole in the bottom where the seam had ripped. I went in a weekend trip and packed very lightly - suitcase had plenty of empty space and was not extended. I have no idea if the product arrived damaged and I didn’t notice (the tear is along the seam and easily missed if not extended) or if this happened in first use. Either way this is not customary for Samsonite products and I’m very dissatisfied. I’ve attempted to reach customer service via phone and have been unsuccessful. Help!!
customer_reviews.author: Meagaan T.

customer_reviews.title: the Samsonite is a sturdy and well made carry-on for the price
customer_reviews.text: The is well made and cost effective. The only thing I miss relative to slightly more expensivepreviously owned is the Travelpro's front pocket, which is large enough for a laptop. This Samsonite has two pockets, neither large enough for a laptop, thus you have to put it in the main compartment. It causes unneeded digging for the computer when traveling, but other than that, the Samsonite is a sturdy and well made carry-on for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Lots of places to put everything you need for on board airplane or for an overnight-er.
customer_reviews.text: Really love this bag. Have taken it on airplane. It is a little big to put under the seat unless you are in an aisle seat. You can get it under the seat, but not a lot of room for your feet. So you probably would be more comfortable to put it in the overhead. Love the spinners. I have the 29" and the 25", too, and have found the spinners help when the bags are packed full and heavy. I can handle them pretty well. (I'm 71 years old.) Even up and down stairs. Have a couple handles so you can carry two different ways depending on the room you have to maneuver.
customer_reviews.author: Linda4664

customer_reviews.title: I like my new suitcase
customer_reviews.text: I had my last Samsonite suitcase for over 20 years when it finally bit the dust and had to be replace. This suitcase is great because it's so lightweight but sturdy. It has lots of convenient-to-access outside pockets and a roomy interior. The only drawback is that it didn't come with any lock.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. CALCOTEX

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous, light and rugged. A BUY!
customer_reviews.text: Extremely durable and gorgeous. The wheels roll like Silk. We can't wait to travel with these. Make sure to check out different colors as the price can differentiate up to $30. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: BronzeHorse71

customer_reviews.title: Time will tell
customer_reviews.text: Nice bag but not the quality of our older Samsonite luggage. Pull up handle feels a bit flimsy and corner protectors are much smaller and thinner than their older models. Great storage options for packing but we'll see how it holds up to airline baggage handlers!
customer_reviews.author: Danni

customer_reviews.title: Overall Good Suitcase
customer_reviews.text: The suitcase was the perfect size for my recent two week vacation in Europe. It was a little to large to fit in the overhead for some of the airlines I was flying, but that is my fault for not checking beforehand. I would give it five stars but the handle bent when I was lifting the suitcase to go up some stairs and now it’s a bit difficult to push in and out. I probably should have lifted from the handle, but it was in the middle of a busy train station and I’ve done this numerous time with other luggage with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Samsonite - The best for Your Dollar
customer_reviews.text: Great suitcase, like everything Samsonite manufactures. I have traveled the world with my suitcases, Samsonite all, and have never had one fail on me. The oldest Samsonite, a hard-side, that I had was purchased in 1966. I finally gave it away two years ago, sadly, and I am sure it will serve its new owner well.
customer_reviews.author: J. A. Hunsinger

customer_reviews.title: Way too heavy for a carry-on!
customer_reviews.text: I compared this one and the American Tourister Splash 2 Upright 21, and ended up keeping the Spash, almost 2 pounds lighter than the Samsonite and equally roomy. I weighed this one at about 8.5 pounds, not what you would want when going to Europe or for that matter anywhere!
customer_reviews.author: svtrader

customer_reviews.title: Samsonite luggage
customer_reviews.text: Great suitcase, it was big enough for a 5 day trip with a big coat and pillow inside as well. The wheels are nice and quiet on airport tile and roll easily and the zippers work smoothly. It got battered around pretty good and it still looks brand new, it is tough and hopefully durable.
customer_reviews.author: Chaotic

customer_reviews.title: Not what one expects from Samsonite.
customer_reviews.text: While this product is functional I'm disappointed in the quality for Samsonite. Purchased these specifically for a two week trip around the UK. The style and color are nice but the structural integrity is weak. Sides bulge out, they do not hold shape and zipper teeth are damaged despite not overpacking. The handles don't appear to be sufficient enough for longevity.
customer_reviews.author: Enzo

customer_reviews.title: Samonite still deserves a 5 though
customer_reviews.text: Though its a great bag with nice strong material it didn't have any nice detail that stood out for me plus I didn't like that one long pocket that runs across the front the two reasons I sent it back though was the over the shoulder handles didn't line up on both sides and I found the delsey carryon cheaper a tad bit smaller and with more details
customer_reviews.author: Dezrine D

customer_reviews.title: Good, solid suitcase.
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these, Used them last week on an international flight, they worked fine. Took one star off as I would have liked it if it expanded a bit more. I would buy again. My 13 year old and 11 years old were able to pull them pretty effortlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Neel S.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: kept up great during 2 week trip and survived the airline's handling
customer_reviews.author: Jenna Younker

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Size!
customer_reviews.text: Great value & the price can't be beat. The size is correct for a carry-on piece with major airlines. Other pieces are just an inch or 2 bigger & you may have to check them if the airline is picky. The zippers & wheels work well, very easy to maneuver through airports & narrow airplane isles. This piece fits perfectly inside the Samsonite 25" Aspire Xlite suitcase for easy storage. I'm very happy with this suitcase.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Striking blue color
customer_reviews.text: I really like this color for the suitcase since it is easy to spot and pick up at luggage terminal. The suitcase is lightweight which matters now a days due to airlines charging for over weighted suitcases. It rolls easily with the smaller wheels on the base. I like the deep pockets on outside and inside the suitcase.
customer_reviews.author: Stella H

customer_reviews.title: We'll see how it wears.  Replacing a 20 year old samonsite
customer_reviews.text: Attractive case Pros: Extremely lightweight Spacious interior Cons: there is no pull tab on the liner zipper. I considered it a defect and the case was replaced. There is no pull tab on this one either. I comsider that a defect, had to grasp the little zipper head without a pull.
customer_reviews.author: Sandie

customer_reviews.title: I like the wheels
customer_reviews.text: This is a big suitcase that follows airline restrictions. We used it for a five week family vacation to Egypt. It held up well through multiple moves between destinations. I like the wheels, they made a large suitcase easy to maneuver. The blue made it easy to identify.
customer_reviews.author: Brooklyn

customer_reviews.title: Dilemma
customer_reviews.text: I am changing my review for this product. I sent it to my sister who was due travel ina few days. She just told me what had happened. The luggage was super heavy. International travels get 50 pounds total. This suitcase itself is like 8 kgs (17 pounds). I thought samsonite was a good brand. I paid freaking $99 for this suitcase. I am super disappointed. I have to talk with amazon to work things out to return this bag.
customer_reviews.author: Ashesh

customer_reviews.title: Nice bag but doesn't nest with other pieces.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this 29" and the 25" bag. They are very light but they dont nest together. Due to space shortage for storing when not in use- I had to return both pieces.
customer_reviews.author: sandy D.s

customer_reviews.title: The color makes it easy to identify your luggage
customer_reviews.text: The color makes it easy to identify your luggage. Nice and roomy but not "too big." Rolls swift and easily. For some airlines, you can get away with using it as a carry on. :-) We used it on our family vacation to Belize and it worked as both a checked and a carry on. It was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Heather J.

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this set right before my most recent trip. When they arrived, I was pleasantly surprised by how much room there is inside of the suitcases. The liners are a good material and the pockets make it easy to store smaller items. I was very happy with how much I could pack inside them. Walking with them during our trip was easy. The handle extended out to multiple locking positions and the 4 swivel wheels made them very easy to move. All in all, I'm very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Rolls easily, almost too easily
customer_reviews.text: Appears to be constructed very well using durable materials. Shockingly light weight. Rolls easily, almost too easily. I like it. Real test will be when i have to check this on an airplane and they beat it around. So far i just use it for my local travel.
customer_reviews.author: S. Swindells

product_meta.title: Samsonite Aspire Xlite Softside Expandable Luggage with Spinner Wheels, Black, 2-Piece Set (20/25)
product_meta.description: Size:2-Piece Set (20/25)| Color:BlackTravel with confidence. Travel with Aspire xLite. A bold fusion of lightweight construction and durability. Rugged polyester and steel wire construction create a unique combination of strength, flexibility and capacity. Aspire xLite's effortless mobility is enhanced by the use of sleek, smooth rolling in-line skate wheels and multi-directional spinner wheels.
feature_bullets: 2 PIECE SET contains: 20" Carry On (meets most carry-on size restrictions for those traveling domestically and looking to stay light) and 25" Spinner (maximize your packing power and the ideal checked bag for longer trips)

10 YEAR LIMITED WARRANTY: Samsonite products are rigorously tested to ensure our products meet stringent standards. This set comes with a 10-year warranty against defects in materials and workmanship.
ULTRA LIGHTWEIGHT and DURABLE 680D Polyester construction, keeping cases beautiful trip after trip
FOUR MULTI-DIRECTIONAL Spinner wheels for easy mobility, rolls upright so there is no weight on your arm or shoulder
PADDED TOP and SIDE Carry handles provide comfort when lifting a fully packed case, quick stash front zipper pocket
CROSS STRAPS Secure the contents of your luggage to help prevent shifting that can cause damage, also help keep the contents of your luggage organized
SELF RETRACTING carry handle that maintains a low profile when not in use

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,560 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
